result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell Romont Smalley Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Russell Romont Smalley Sr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Russell Romont Smalley Sr was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time/ part time employment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised  that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with known illegal drugs users, manufacturers, deliverers.
No contact with known gang members.
No possession of firearms, ammunition, magazines, holsters, body armor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed ncessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens at least one (1) time per month.

DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by 10/24/2018. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA.

After review of case and discussion with Judge, court finds bail forfeiture of 3/11/16 was entered in error. Court amends bail forfeiture entered 3/11/16 from $200.00 to $500.00.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.

17A 071668
payment reversed and reapplied

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 106 days time served. The Court granted Day Reporting Center and Huber privileges for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.
- No possession of drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with known illegal drug users/manufacturers/deliverers.
- No contact with known gang members.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Maintain fulltime/part time employment.
- Cognitive Behavioral Intervention program.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 10/24/2018.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Russell Romont Smalley in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Defendant Russell Romont Smalley in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.  Case calendared for plea hearing/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant. 

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Repeater enhancer on COUNT 1 dismissed.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3 AND 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered counts dismissed.

Case proceeded to sentencing.

OFF THE RECORD:  Attorney Chris Bailey in court, defendant Russell Romont Smalley not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case remains calendared in Br. 11 for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.
